org.gearvrf

Class GVRBaseSensor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRBaseSensor

  • public class GVRBaseSensor
extends java.lang.Object
    Create an instance of this class to receive SensorEvents whenever an input device interacts with a GVRSceneObject.

    Note that to successfully receive SensorEvents for an object make sure that the sensor is enabled and a valid ISensorEvents is attached.

    To attach a ISensorEvents, set the sensor to the object (e.g., GVRSceneObject), use GVRSceneObject.getEventReceiver() to get the GVREventReceiver, and then use GVREventReceiver.addListener(IEvents) to add the ISensorEvents.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GVRBaseSensor

        public GVRBaseSensor(GVRContext gvrContext)
        Constructor for GVRBaseSensor. By default the depth order property is set to false see GVRBaseSensor(GVRContext, boolean)
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - the GVRContext associated with the application.

      • GVRBaseSensor

        public GVRBaseSensor(GVRContext gvrContext,
                     boolean sendEventsInDepthOrder)
        Constructor for GVRBaseSensor. GVRBaseSensor has an option to group SensorEvent according to depth order. See SensorEvent.EventGroup for more details. Enabling this feature will incur extra cost every time there is a change in the GVRCursorController position or state. The SensorEvents need to be grouped and sorted according to the distance of the associated GVRSceneObjects from the origin. This feature should only be turned on if needed. The grouping of SensorEvents can be useful to apps that have multiple overlapping GVRSceneObjects and the application has to decide which of the GVRSceneObjects will handle the SensorEvent. The depth order sorting can be enabled and disabled using setDepthOrderEnabled(boolean)
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - the GVRContext associated with the application.
        sendEventsInDepthOrder - true if SensorEvents are supposed to be grouped and sorted according to the depth of the GVRSceneObject. false otherwise.

    • Method Detail

      • disable

        public void disable()
        Use this method to disable the sensor. Does not affect the sensor if already disabled.

      • enable

        public void enable()
        Use this method to enable the sensor. Does not affect the sensor if already enabled.

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Get the status of the sensor using this call.
        Returns:
        true if the sensor is enabled. false if not.

      • getOwner

        protected IEventReceiver getOwner()
        Gets the owner of the sensor. The owner of the sensor can receive events from the sensor.
        Returns:
        The owner object.

      • setOwner

        protected void setOwner(IEventReceiver owner)
        Sets the owner of the sensor. The owner of the sensor can receive events from the sensor, and must implement the interface IEventReceiver.
        Parameters:
        owner - The owner object of the sensor.

      • isDepthOrderEnabled

        public boolean isDepthOrderEnabled()
        Checks if the depth ordering is enabled for the GVRBaseSensor
        Returns:
        true is depth ordering is enabled, false otherwise.

      • setDepthOrderEnabled

        public void setDepthOrderEnabled(boolean depthOrderEnabled)
        Enable or disable the Depth ordering of SensorEvents for GVRBaseSensor. Enabling this feature will incur extra cost every time there is a change in the GVRCursorController position or state. The SensorEvents need to be grouped and sorted according to the distance of the associated GVRSceneObjects from the origin. This feature should only be turned on if needed. The grouping of SensorEvents can be useful to apps that have multiple overlapping GVRSceneObjects and the application has to decide which of the GVRSceneObjects will handle the SensorEvent.
        Parameters:
        depthOrderEnabled - true to enable depth order, false to disable depth order.
        See Also:
        SensorEvent.EventGroup, GVRBaseSensor(GVRContext, boolean)
